meanings.definition: A large, long-legged bird of prey in the falcon family, found in the Americas.
meanings.sent1: Caracaras soar high in the sky, searching for food.
meanings.sent2: I saw a group of caracaras perched on a tree branch.
meanings.sent3: The caracaras decided to have a race to see who could fly the fastest.
meanings.sent4: The caracaras' keen eyesight makes them skilled hunters.
meanings.sent5: The majestic caracaras glided effortlessly through the air.

meanings.definition: The plural form of caracara, referring to multiple individuals of the species.
meanings.sent1: Many caracaras were spotted in the field, each with its own unique markings.
meanings.sent2: The caracaras in the sky circled above, a sight to behold.
meanings.sent3: The group of caracaras held a meeting to discuss their next hunting strategy.
meanings.sent4: The caracaras' unity in flight was a beautiful display of teamwork.
meanings.sent5: The flock of caracaras filled the sky with their graceful presence.
